title: U.S. states plan to sue Facebook next week - sources
text: A group of U.S. states led by New York is investigating Facebook Inc for possible antitrust violations and plans to file a lawsuit against the social media giant next week, four sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Facebook Just Spent $1 Billion to Monetize Messaging
text: Its latest acquisition aims to get more businesses using its messaging apps.

title: Option Trader Bets $1.5M On Facebook Despite Trump's Section 230 Threat
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) shares gained 1% on Wednesday after President Donald Trump threatened to remove a key legal protection for social media companies. Trump threatened to withhold military funding unless Section 230 of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) is removed, but at least one large Facebook option trader isn't concerned about Trump's claims.

title: Facebook Is Buying Kustomer For A Reported Price Of Over $1 Billion
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) recently announced it is buying a company called Kustomer. These are the details about the deal.

title: Irish privacy regulator's chief on the data transfer dispute with Facebook
text: Irish Data Protection Commissioner Helen Dixon said she hopes the regulator's legal dispute with Facebook over data transfers will conclude by early 2021.

title: Ireland's privacy watchdog hopes data transfer dispute with Facebook will conclude by early 2021
text: Irish Data Protection Commissioner Helen Dixon said she hopes the regulator will get clarity on a resolution to the spat by early 2021.

title: Facebook buys customer service startup Kustomer, aiding its social commerce play
text: On Monday, Facebook announced it would buy Kustomer, a customer relationship management (CRM) startup that will provide services to businesses that use Messenger and WhatsApp for communication with customers. While Facebook has been pushing heavily into social commerce over the past few months, its investments thus far have generally been centered around improving discoverability and adding new features to Shops on Facebook and Instagram. The Kustomer acquisition, meanwhile, focuses less on the public-facing Shops and more on private communication.

title: Facebook-backed cryptocurrency Libra rebranded as Diem in quest for regulatory approval
text: Facebook-backed cryptocurrency Libra has been renamed “Diem” in an effort to gain regulatory approval by stressing the project's independence.

title: EU's Crackdown on Big Tech
text: Dec.02 -- The European Union is set to unveil sweeping legislation adding to the regulation facing internet companies, such as Amazon, Alphabet and Facebook. The tech giants are warning the new rules may hinder innovation and are holding a video call with EU officials later today.
